sn1.2:1.2: Then, late at night, a glorious deity, lighting up the entire Jeta’s Grove, went up to the Buddha, bowed, stood to one side, and said to him,
sn1.2:2.1: “Good fellow, do you know the liberation, emancipation, and seclusion of sentient beings?”
sn1.2:4.1: “But how is it that you know the liberation, emancipation, and seclusion of sentient beings?”
sn1.2:5.1: “Due to the ending of relish for rebirth;
sn1.2:5.2: due to the finishing of perception and consciousness;
sn1.2:5.3: due to the cessation and stilling of feelings—
sn1.2:5.4: that, good sir, is how I know the liberation,
sn1.2:5.5: emancipation, and seclusion of sentient beings.”
